metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3524 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been declared asproblematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the functionipv6_renew_options of the component IPv6 Handler. The manipulation leads tomemory leak. The attack can be launched remotely. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier VDB-211021 was assigned tothis vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3524` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-200-generic - 4.15.0-200.211
linux-image-4.15.0-200-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-200.211
linux-image-4.15.0-200-lowlatency - 4.15.0-200.211
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-200-generic - 4.15.0-200.211
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-200-lowlatency - 4.15.0-200.211
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-135-generic - 5.4.0-135.152~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-135-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-135.152~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-135-lowlatency - 5.4.0-135.152~18.04.2

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-135-lowlatency - 5.4.0-135.152~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-200.211').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-135.152~18.04.2').
